metadata.synopsis: When a paladin becomes an oathbreaker the Oathbreaker knight will appear to be their guide. He will stay at the camp as a camp follower.If a non-oathbreaker paladin speaks to the Oathbreaker, they begin a short interactive dialogue. The Oathbreaker is mildly impressed that they are still dedicated to their cause, but warns that the course ahead will test their commitment.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Start the game as a paladin.2. Become an oathbreaker (oe MakeOathbreaker with the paladin selected).3. End the day.

1.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
1.text: Your resolve changes with the wind, oathbreaker. Speak.

2.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
2.text: Speak, oathbreaker. I will hear you.

54.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
54.text: If you stumble, know there is no shame in falling. Only release.

77.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
77.text: You are between worlds, paladin. Have you made a choice?

86.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
86.text: Oathbreaker. What do you need of me?

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I'm a child of Bhaal - how could I ever have become a paladin?

147.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
147.text: Nobody belongs entirely to their bloodline, even those fathered by a god.

158.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
158.text: You chose a path, made a pledge, and Bhaal had no part in it.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I hope to lead a life without Bhaal again.

29.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
29.text: Then hold to your oath. Let it be a comfort and a guide.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Did I break my oath before, when I went to the Temple?

122.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
122.text: Yes, and not for the first time. We have met before. I expect we will meet again.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Why am I allowed to reclaim my oath, knowing what I am?

99.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
99.text: It is what you do, not what you are, that determines your oath.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: What happens if I reclaim my oath?

74.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
74.text: Returning to your oath means relinquishing the darkness within you. Its evil must be banished.

162.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
162.text: Your oath-sworn powers will return. You will be bound again by the decrees you promise to uphold.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I want to become an oathbreaker.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I will become an oathbreaker once more.

41.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
41.text: For casting aside your oath, you will be reclaimed.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. The Oathbreaker NPC raises their hand towards the player, as a flash of light transitions us to the oathbreaker dimension, a strange void rippling with dark fogs and turquoise vapours.NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

129.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
129.text: This is your fate. Your right. Oathbreaker.
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. As the Oathbreaker NPC speaks, the vapours swirl and circle around the player. NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

128.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
128.text: May you wield the darkness well.
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. The Oathbreaker NPC is barely visible through the growing maelstrom whipping around the player. As the final words of their warning ring out, the player shields their eyes against a blinding flash, transitioning them to the character re=spec screen.NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I wish to take up my oath again.

24.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
24.text: First, you must pay the agreed price. Material sacrifice is required, to prove your words have substance.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Pay the gold. Reclaim your oath. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

178.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
178.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the gold (unseen)

68.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
68.text: Tell me, why do you wish to reclaim your oath?

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Only in wielding the powers I lost can I achieve my aims. It is my destiny. My right.

140.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
140.text: A higher purpose. A greater calling.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Abandoning my oath tainted my soul. I wish to make it right.

70.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
70.text: Repairing what was damaged. Atoning for the past.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I understand better the meaning of my oath. I can serve it now, as I could not before.

16.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
16.text: Newfound wisdom. A sense of clarity.

138.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Oathbreaker holds out a hand, as the player finds themselves back in the Oathbraker dimension. They drop to one knee, their head bowed. NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

136.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
136.text: You swear to defend life itself, to protect all that is good and natural, and to repel wickedness wherever it threatens.
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. As the oathbreaker speaks, a glowing orb slowly manifests in front of the player. The player looks up at it, determined.NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

75.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
75.text: The Oath of the Ancients is once more yours to fulfil.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. At the oathbreaker's instruction, the player reaches towards the glowing orb. The orb moves closer to their hand, the glow intensifying before a blinding flash takes us to the character creation screen. (Player never visibly makes contact with orb)NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

82.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
82.text: You swear to act with strength, compassion, and responsibility. To be a paragon of honour and justice.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. As the oathbreaker speaks, a glowing orb slowly manifests in front of the player. The player looks up at it, determined.NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

55.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
55.text: The Oath of Devotion is once more yours to fulfil.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. At the oathbreaker's instruction, the player reaches towards the glowing orb. The orb moves closer to their hand, the glow intensifying before a blinding flash takes us to the character creation screen. (Player never visibly makes contact with orb)NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

156.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
156.text: You swear to deliver righteous retribution, vanquishing your enemies and aiding those who suffer at their hands.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. As the oathbreaker speaks, a glowing orb slowly manifests in front of the player. The player looks up at it, determined.NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

78.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
78.text: The Oath of Vengeance is once more yours to fulfil.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. At the oathbreaker's instruction, the player reaches towards the glowing orb. The orb moves closer to their hand, the glow intensifying before a blinding flash takes us to the character creation screen. (Player never visibly makes contact with orb)NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I seek moral guidance. It cannot be found lurking in the shadows.

56.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
56.text: A desire for purity. Moral absolution.

173.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
173.text: Your coffers are empty. The price must be paid.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I can't afford it. Isn't there some other way?

88.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
88.text: There are less worthy objects demanding a far higher price. For redemption, this is no great ask.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Buying salvation sounds like cheating to me.

31.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
31.text: It was the bounty placed on an oathbreaker's head. It was the sum placed on my own.

10.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
10.text: This is the cost of your transgression.

44.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
44.text: That is your choice. I will be here, should you reconsider.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I wish to take up my oath again.

167.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
167.text: With each transgression, your burden grows. As does the price of redemption.
167.context: NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

71.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
71.text: You may still reclaim your oath. So long as you are willing to pay. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
71.context: NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

23.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
23.text: Then the path to redemption remains closed. Only when the gold is paid can your oath be reclaimed.
23.context: NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Why should I pay more? I did no worse than before.

150.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
150.text: Oaths are not to be discarded and reclaimed without cause. Your inconstancy bears a cost.
150.context: NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

101.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
101.text: If you believe your oath to be of lesser value, you are under no obligation to reclaim it. It is your decision.
101.context: NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Hand over the gold. Reclaim your oath. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

40.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player hands the gold to the Oathbreaker NPC. At the moment the gold is transferred, the player finds themselves back in the Oathbraker dimension. They drop to one knee, their head bowed. NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

60.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
60.text: Without gold, your pledge cannot be made. Return to me when you are ready to pay.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Hand over the gold. Reclaim your oath. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Why did you abandon your oath?

47.speaker: Player
47.text: That was a brave decision. It can't have been easy.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Turning on your own people? No wonder you were cast out.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Did you know you would be cast out?

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Do you regret betraying your oath?

38.speaker: Player
38.text: What powers do I have as an oathbreaker?

119.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
119.text: I have been waiting for you.

103.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
103.text: I felt the moment of your liberation - the shedding of your bond.

92.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
92.text: You called to me. I am here to show you the way.

152.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
152.text: I was the first. The first to swear. The first to fall.

169.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
169.text: When another's oath is broken, I stand witness. I hear their sorrow. I see their jubilation. I guide their hand.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I don't need your help, stranger. I can look after myself.

20.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
20.text: Resolve. Purpose. These will serve you well on your journey.

63.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
63.text: I come to offer solace. And warning. For the way is soaked in the blood of the desperate and the damned.

52.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
52.text: A journey with no end, trodden only by the desperate and the damned.

57.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
57.text: It is a path I have walked since the moment I fell. Now you will walk it too.

28.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
28.text: You swore to protect life itself. To serve the natural order. To protect those who value life, and vanquish those who would destroy it.

117.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
117.text: Tell me - why did you abandon your oath?

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I am a poor paladin - my mind is shattered and cruelty is within.

124.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
124.text: Cruelty need not conflict with purpose, and a shattered mind may yet uphold an oath.

9.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
9.text: But you have fallen, and it seems you do not fully comprehend the reason why.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I had no choice. To follow it was to act against my conscience.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I tired of doctrine and dogma. I wanted freedom.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: It was not my intention. My actions had unexpected consequence.

19.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
19.text: To know the reason for your fall is, perhaps, to know the shape of things to come.

80.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
80.text: Take comfort in your undoing. I, like you, abandoned my cause. But much can still be achieved.

105.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
105.text: Your oath is broken. The light within you fades. A new power is awakening.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Tell me more about these powers.

34.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
34.text: Darkness will obey your summons. The dead will march to your rhythm.

121.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
121.text: Even now, these shadows gather around you. They sense the cracks in your armour. They yearn to be used, to be inflicted.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Isn't there any way to reclaim my oath?

115.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
115.text: It is possible, but such a promise must not be made lightly. Wealth must be sacrificed, and your soul re-pledged.

102.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
102.text: It is wise to first consider what is gained, and what is lost in the bargain.

170.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
170.text: Should you wish to do so, speak with me again.

30.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
30.text: I served a noble lord. I fought for him without question or restraint. Where his light shone, my sword followed.
30.context: NodeContext: Controlled, explaining events that have long since lost their emotion

172.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
172.text: In his name, I razed villages, put thousands to the sword. I believed our greater purpose required such brutality, such sacrifice.
172.context: NodeContext: Controlled, explaining events that have long since lost their emotion

175.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
175.text: But his light was so radiant, it blinded me to all else. I could not see the darkness and corruption of the path he led me down.
175.context: NodeContext: Controlled, explaining events that have long since lost their emotion

12.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
12.text: When I finally saw the truth, he would not be reasoned with. So I ended him. For this, I was called 'Oathbreaker'.
12.context: NodeContext: Controlled, explaining events that have long since lost their emotion

18.speaker: Player
18.text: That was a brave decision. It can't have been easy.

127.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
127.text: It was merely a choice. As I have made countless others since.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Murdering your own lord? No wonder you were cast out.

111.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
111.text: To exist outside the confines of his doctrine was something I welcomed. It was no punishment.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Did you know what it meant to break your oath like that?

39.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
39.text: I knew the consequences would be worse for those he continued to harm.

97.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
97.text: What's past is past. We are here to discuss your future.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Do you regret betraying your oath?

61.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
61.text: Regret is for those who would act differently. I feel no such desire.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: What did you achieve after abandoning your oath?

148.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
148.text: I wielded the powers of darkness, yet held a candle for those who needed the light.

146.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
146.text: My actions followed no teaching apart from my own justification. Good or ill, I made my choices.

112.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
112.text: Eventually, I heard the call of others who had strayed. I showed them the way, as I show you now.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: I'm ready. I will become an oathbreaker.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I don't want this. I want to remain pure.

42.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
42.text: You may refuse. But this alone will not restore what was lost.

3.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
3.text: Without light to guide you, or darkness to consume, you will remain adrift. Powerless.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I will not be tainted. I will find a way to reclaim my oath.

33.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
33.text: Until that day, I will be here, and my offer will remain.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Powerless? I don't like the sound of that.

174.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
174.text: The powers you wielded were not yours alone. They were a gift, offered on the condition that your oath was upheld.

62.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
62.text: In the darkness, new power beckons. In the light, the promise of restoration. But in between, there is nothing.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I need time to think about it.

110.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
110.text: It is a decision worthy of consideration.

36.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
36.text: When you feel ready to make it, I will be waiting for you.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: In that case, I accept. I will become an oathbreaker.

93.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
93.text: Do not resist. Surrender, and be remade.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext:  The oathbreaker raises their arm towards the player. A blinding flash transitions us into the oathbreaker dimension, a strange void filled with dark fogs and an unnatural turquoise light. Turquoise 'oathbreaker' vapours ripple and stir restlessly around the Oathbreaker NPC.NodeContext:  Oathbreaker Dimension

45.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
45.text: Though born of a vile source, these powers can be used for good or ill.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Oathbreaker Dimension. Under the Oathbreaker's command, the vapours approach the player, swirling around them. gathering speed. The player looks around, uncertain, as they are enveloped. The oathbreaker speaks -NodeContext:  Oathbreaker Dimension

151.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
151.text: Your oath no longer binds you - the choice is yours alone.
151.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. The Oathbreaker NPC is barely visible through the growing maelstrom whipping around the player. As the final words of their warning ring out, the player shields their eyes against a blinding flash, transitioning them to the character re=spec screen.NodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I no longer believed in its teachings.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I owe you no explanation. My reasons are mine alone.

164.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
164.text: You swore to defend the defenceless, to stand as an emblem for all that is good and just in this world.

126.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
126.text: You swore to deliver vengeance, to hunt down those who had wronged and ensure they felt the sting of justice.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I'm in no mood for riddles. Whatever you have to say, spit it out.

87.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
87.text: I offer no riddles. Nor do I offer clarity. Where you must walk, there are no signposts. There are no maps.

133.speaker: Oathbreaker Knight
133.text: Your oath stands firm. Should you stumble, I will be waiting.
